nodes.bodyText: We can modify QueryRunner createKuduQueryRunnerTpch(TestingKuduServer kuduServer, Optional<String> kuduSchemaEmulationPrefix, Iterable<TpchTable<?>> tables) to re-use this method

Probe is pretty technical term. Also, in theory, DF can be a result of something else.
what about
kudu.dynamic-filtering.wait-timeout

?
Why not just intersect this with tableHandle.getConstraint() above ?
I think you can use directExecutor, unless you ran into some issue which led to using thread pool here ?
Can be simplified by removing the conditions above and modifying this to if (blockingTimeoutMillis <= 0 || !dynamicFilter.isAwaitable())
We don't need any of the assertions around dynamicFiltersStats as these are connector agnostic and already getting tested in DynamicFilterService

The test case is most like TestHiveDynamicPartitionPruning.
I think we assert dynamicFiltersCompleted so we know dynamic_filtering_wait_timeout takes effect. Otherwise the query might finised with dynamicFilters not Completed.

Right, collection of dynamic filters may or may not complete if the probe side does not wait for it. Still the utilisation of dynamic filters by the connector remains untested. Ideally if we were able to test that then the assertions about dynamicFiltersStats will not be needed here, it's enough to have them tested once in TestHiveDynamicPartitionPruning.
Please try adding assertions about rows read from Kudu in the tests here similar to the way assertDynamicFiltering is used in TestMemorySmoke.
Please check if adding assertions along the lines of assertDynamicFiltering in TestMemorySmoke works
Sorry for the misunderstanding, I actually meant adding assertions about rows read from Kudu in the tests here similar to the way assertDynamicFiltering works in TestMemorySmoke.
If I'm understanding this correctly, this will wait for narrowing down of dynamic filter only twice, ideally we want to wait for dynamic filter to complete.

We could rename this to KuduDynamicFilteringSplitSource.
Instead of the future, we could take the delegate split source and dynamic filter as parameters.
You could then implement the waiting logic in the methods here using the dynamic filter and delegate split source.

I was thinking of something along the lines of DynamicFilteringPageSource in MemoryPageSourceProvider but adapted to ConnectorSplitSource and implementing a timeout instead of blocking until completion.
I think your current way works too, but doing it that way could be cleaner.

I don't see any simplification of domains taking place in Kudu connector, so we don't have any point of reference for how big a predicate Kudu can handle.
I would suggest
TupleDomain<ColumnHandle> constraint = tableHandle.getConstraint()
                .intersect(dynamicFilter.getCurrentPredicate().simplify(100));

This way we don't change existing behaviour without DF and put a reasonable limit on DFs.
Added @MinDuration("0ms") on the getter as other config

nodes.bodyText: DF could be narrowed down multiple times (you need to create future in getNextBatch). You could also use approach as in io.prestosql.plugin.hive.BackgroundHiveSplitLoader.HiveSplitLoaderTask#process
whenCompleted() is a recursive method which wait for narrowing multiple times until not awaitable.
don't use aberrations s, rename to splitSource
This is prone to race condition, future could complete just after future.isDone() is checked

extract new KuduDynamicFilteringSplitSource(table, splitSchedulingStrategy, dynamicFilter, blockingTimeoutMillis); to internal method and don't call top-level getSplitSource (it creases tricky recursive flow)
This case is redundent. Coercion is already tested in different places

Let's just have a single DF test in this. Other cases are already covered pretty well. However, it would be nice to have a test like: io.prestosql.plugin.hive.TestBackgroundHiveSplitLoader#testIncompleteDynamicFilterTimeout
I think in negative value case Duration.valueOf will throw exception anyway, we won't reach here
I don't think this check can fail

This test should be on top of KuduSplitManager, similar to TestBackgroundHiveSplitLoader#testIncompleteDynamicFilterTimeout.
You shouldn't have to expose completedOrTimeout to test this.

this still doesn't help with race condition, e.g: other thread might be just after obtaining split source via getSplitSource(table, splitSchedulingStrategy, dynamicFilter) but before exiting .thenApply(result -> getSplitSource(table, splitSchedulingStrategy, dynamicFilter));. In that case cancellation would be successful, but split source is not closed.

Could it be that cancellation succeeded and splitSourceFuture created split source anyway (I think it still might be the case).

I do not think the case should exist.
If dynamicFilterFuture cancellation succeeded, then dynamicFilterFuture is not completed normally, then function getSplitSource() is not triggered.
Reasoning backward, if getSplitSource() is already triggered, we know dynamicFilterFuture is completed normally, dynamicFilterFuture cancellation should fail.
I don't think it can complete exceptionally
If isFinished() is called after close(), and dynamicFilterFuture cancellation in close() succeeded, splitSourceFuture is completed exceptionally.
It should return true then here

In this case, splitSource is not created since getSplitSource() is not triggered. I think return false is more reasonable.
isFinished() return false after close() should not be a problem. In FixedSplitSource,  isFinished() aslo can return false after close().
we changed that method to return list now: io.prestosql.plugin.memory.TestMemorySmoke#getOperatorRowsRead
we changed that method to accept array of ints now: io.prestosql.plugin.memory.TestMemorySmoke#assertDynamicFiltering
nit: test for kudu config is missing
